bsreDdjNxbBUlalBWxq_8g.text: In town for work. Asked the hotel if they had any recommendations for dinner and they recommended Walnut Street for dining and shopping. I went on Yelp and found this gem. The decor is modern and sleek - very classy, warm, and welcoming. The menu is amazing and so different. I got the "Down the Rabbit Hole" cocktail - reposado, horchata, and cardamom. I love trying new tequila drinks so I was very pleased. The waitress was so sweet and knowledgeable and recommended so many things I decided to try a few small plates to get to try several things. I tried the salt cod, chestnut ravioli, and veal sausage. After the salt cod, I was satisfied and could have had only that for my meal, but I'm glad I tried so many delicious things. Based on these, I'm sure the whole menu is incredible and if back in the area I would absolutely come back. The waitress told me this place is only about three months old, so I want to highly recommend it and I hope this restaurant is vey successful! I also overheard the bartender tell some diners that their charcuterie is cured in house which is also awesome.   I only have two suggestions - first, I was looking for an early dinner and one of the tipping points for my choosing to come here was that they opened (according to yelp) at 4:30 PM. When hotel shuttle dropped me off, I noticed they don't open til 5. It's snowing out so I had to wander around for a half hour. Luckily, there's lots of shops in the area. And it was WELL worth the wait. But that should be noted.  My second suggestion is to add a larger sign. The shuttle and I were looking for it and it was difficult to find. This storefront is not well labeled (neither the address number nor the name) unless you are walking right up to it. Other than these two items, it was a flawless experience. The staff was friendly and welcoming and all the other customers seemed to have incredible experiences as well.

0nflpMAr8CjDgTQ8sogJcQ.text: This is the best new restaurant in Pittsburgh. The food is innovative, beautiful and balanced. Every flavor sings. Try the trout or rabbit. DO NOT SKIP DESERT! I cannot speak highly enough of service and creative dishes.

X-9fFoq6df3-KwxfNySSow.text: Salted cod was good if you got a bite that actually had cod, otherwise you just have overpriced mashed potatoes which are tasty but not worth 15 dollars.  Had pork loin which was very good but the turnips were raw.  Finally the cocktail Mulberry Blush,  need some fizz either the soda was flat or it didn't have soda in it.  Also they put for a garnish this big piece of mint that was wilted and looked gross. WHY?  Overall it was mediocre at best.

T1nYBvGGH8YDl-FXdLTMeA.text: We're here weekly. While I love dining at the bar, table service is very hit and miss. The food is quite good, but the service isn't. Such a shame. There is so much potential but if you can't deliver on service it doesn't matter. At the end of the day, you're in the service business. Take care of your customers.

VpdJU-OSOOFxT3T0IDbYuQ.text: For many years, I have found the restaurants on (and near) Walnut to be somewhat disappointing. Some are just plain bad, but even the ones that serve good food tend to be conventional and perhaps play it "too safe."  Happily Acorn is an exception.  I sampled the pork belly and the fiddlehead fern -- both small plates, but the portions are sufficient for a light dinner. The pork belly dish presents a good balance of taste and texture. The date brings out the sweetness; the crunchy pickled veggies serve as a counter point to the luscious fatty meat. The fiddlehead dish is served shakshuka style, in a cast iron pan. It was very satisfying, with the egg yoke still soft and runny, and the salsa verde offering a mild hint of heat; I'm not usually a huge dill fan, but here, the herb is used judiciously and is not overwhelming; it harmonizes the entire dish well. I also tried the shortcake dessert, expecting a conventional mess of strawberries and cream over biscuits. Happily, Acorn offers a more sophisticated rendition, with Italian merengue, goat cheese ice cream, caramelized peaches, and some freeze-dried strawberry accents. It avoids all the usual pitfalls of a bad strawberry shortcake: it is not cloyingly sweet -- there seems to be some salt in either the crushed nuts or in the ice cream (almost a little too much); it is not too dry; and it's not one-dimensional.   The service was fine. I showed up to dinner alone and without reservation. They seated me right away at a high top by the window; the servers were attentive and did not rush me.  I do think there is a bit of an incongruity about this restaurant --  the vibe of the place is more of a casual bar and grill, like other nearby establishments, but the food and the price is more upscaled. If I just wanted to grab a quick bite to eat while taking a break from shopping, this place would not fit the bill; but then, there are already lots of other outlets for that kind of dining. I'm glad that an inventive restaurant like Acorn has joined the Walnut St. neighborhood.

aYy4Z3SDshICC1UM8HTHtA.text: Great atmosphere, food is good, however.... extremely overpriced.  $56 for chicken for a few pieces of chicken and some lentils? Yikes. $12 for bread? Nah.

MlYEcobDv4Y95hQU8q33hg.text: Service was excellent and everyone was super welcoming.  Our server was enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the menu going out of her way to explain vegetarian options for my wife.   The menu is rather small, but has a decent selection of vegetarian options and varied starters.  The main course options are very limited unless your are able to share with a larger group.  Half of the options are recommended for 2-4 people sharing.  Something to consider for a couple with different palates.    The cocktails were tasty and well thought out.  The $14 glass of cab was pretty average.  Perhaps it had been opened the day before and was not sealed well.  Lacked depth and was a bit hot, but not bad enough to send it back.    We shared a beat salad which was nice and had a mix of textures and flavor profiles.  My wife enjoyed her mushroom pasta.  My lamb dish was below average.  Lamb was served 3 ways but the star of the dish was a tough and over cooked tenderloin.  I could not consume 1/4 of it due to tendon and connective tissue and even had a small bone it.  Overall it was just a middle eastern spiced mess of lamb.    I would give 3.5 if available, but the lamb dish and limited selections don't warrant 4 stars.

LPZAJfR1ugES-EFtlJkWmQ.text: Went tonight for dinner. Our server/ bartender was amazing & very knowledgeable & helpful with the food & drink selection. We had the ribeye for 2 & it was more than enough & better quality than I've had at other 5 star downtown restaurant . This is exactly what the neighborhood needs. It's amazing cocktails with fresh ingredients with the culinary skills to match! Check it out!

2GJcYuLAeoe4JKkeFicaXQ.text: Omg! So much good food! What's cool about Acorn is that you can share the left side of the menu. My friend and I shared four things. We tried the Bread and Butter, Gnocchi, Octopus, and the last thing I forgot the name of. The pics are attached. As yummy to eat as they were to look at!

i0SqI1Q_GiY6lqIJy72dWg.text: I was looking for a new and different place for an early dinner on my birthday. We ended up at Acorn. It is where the old Thai Place used to be on Walnut street in Shadyside. We did wine although they gave a very nice bar and interesting cocktails. We started with the crab "rice", which had no rice and is finished with a soft duck egg. Delicious!  The salt cod brandade was also excellent and the marinated tomorrow's with salmon flake and dill was fresh and bright and sweet and a preparation I never had before. My husband got the Timballo which is layered crepes and cheese finished with grilled octopus and romaine. I had the chicken fried rabbit which included the tenderloin perfectly cooked as well as a crispy fried legs and thighs. No room for dessert but they sounded great and we will definitely be back again and save room.

I1H7sg_oix395YJcH4A-7Q.text: Excellent experience. Food and service were great! Loved our cocktails! We will be back next time we visit!

VvWdPJvBvNI6sdAcZDhrUw.text: This is a new very hip location in town. The vibe is great. Food is decent price. I got the rabbit lasagna which was superb. And the bread pudding is to die for. The menu changes every week or so, so it never gets old.

-9NU296Q6n9UuRJ_RlCxzg.text: We stumbled upon this gem!!!! We ordered three appetizers. They were so amazing we ordered them again to take home for later. Cozy ambience, great competent staff that can handle food allergies too! We recommend the Tabbouleh, Charred Cauliflower and the Gnocchi.

1ifX13HS-X9_0jAGMLaynw.text: Pros:  the whole chicken is absolutely amazing.  It was prepared three different ways, and I just can't understand how they made chicken taste so good.  After appetizers, it was large enough to feed our party of four.  The rigatoni is also amazing and I'll be back for more.  Their signature red blend (I think it was from Engine House wines) is great as well.  The staff was very friendly, and it's great to see RaeLynn (of Dish fame) behind the bar again.   Cons:  I'll echo what another reviewer said about the menu - it lists ingredients but doesn't tell you how anything is prepared (think  "Chicken. Mushroom.  Peas.").  It is pricey, but that seems to be the new normal in Pittsburgh dining these days.

qW0nky4Hdc_eTNfd_J9XlA.text: This restaurant was so awesome! I can't say enough about it. The decor is clean and modern and the food is excellent. I highly recommend the cauliflower appetizer and the duck lasagna. This was a very reasonably priced restaurant for the quality of food. They have my strong recommendation.

rSITsy1io8Jw3iErwXzFSQ.text: Unpleasant. food Ok, but the woman snapping flashbulb pics at everyone's food was almost seizure inducing. PR was more important than good dining. And the server brought blond beer, when I ordered brown.  I suspect that all the good reviews are by friends of the owner.

JtMT0qEExJ7NRbfpSfWspA.text: Chef Scott does an amazing job at creating a unique and delicious menu! The staff is friendly and the service is great! I love the local beers and the wine on tap!

u-nCl4naP0meXof1Mx-hLw.text: Just went to this restaurant for my birthday.  It was my first time there and I was not disappointed!  The menu was so unique and everything was beyond amazing!  The atmosphere was super welcoming which I didn't expect.  The owner came over to our table pretty early on so we could get recommendations which was great!  He even got me dessert (strawberry shortcake!!) for my birthday which made our experience even more special! We will definitely be back!! Definitely recommend checking this spot out!!

AUZ6tUGnQWrYqmZ2PwjVNA.text: Thank you, Acorn, we've been waiting for you!    First, this restaurant is gorgeous, and I love seeing modern in Shadyside.  Second, the service is superb, and that's something that really matters to me as a customer (sometimes even more than the food -- I just like to have a good, life-affirming, friendly experience when I dare to go out sans kiddos).   But omg THE FOOD.  I almost don't know what to say.  I've been here a few times now, have always tried something different, and it's always knocked my socks off.  I think oysters are gross... but not anymore.  I rarely eat meat... but the strip is insane.  Calamari is scary... nope.  I appreciate that things are not always as they seem, and I like to be surprised -- this menu does a fabulous job of being both a little inscrutable and totally familiar all at once.  Totally love the shareables, and think the broccoli tartine in particular is delicious.  The salads (tomato & cucumber, I think?  and a great one with radishes) were unusual and ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL.    Dining here is an experience, and one I don't mind paying for.  Worth it to me.  Would love to see a bigger wine list as you grow, so I'll keep coming back to check.

TUd3TsI-RZsfuwGhIbmx7g.text: Our experience at Acorn was overall very positive! I ordered a Pimms Perfect Summer cocktail to start off and it was the perfect amount of sweetness while being refreshing. We started with the Oysters as our appetizers and boy they were delicious, slightly spicy and full of savory umami (plus points for the presentation, it's pretty cool how the steam comes out of the seaweed). We ordered the Lamb and the Rigatoni and we were impressed by both. The lamb was tender and cooked perfectly. The Rigatoni had home made pasta and had a pickle like flavor which was refreshing and interesting.  We ended with the Lemon desert, and the ice cream was creamy and the pound cake was warm and flavorful. There was no dish where we felt like it was out of place or mediocre. Everything was so good!

I5MAO1AO0Bop8UUHHy5tkw.text: I usually don't write reviews but I feel that the yelp rating at acorn is not representative of my experience or of my fiance's. Also there are only 5 reviews, and 2 of them I believe are from the same couple (husband and wife) that significantly lower the yelp rating, so please do not be discouraged to try this new restaurant.   I came here with my fiance a few weeks ago as we saw this recently opened. Our server was attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. The menu items were unique and interesting. Although some ingredients were unfamiliar to me I am always up for trying and learning new experiences. I believe acorn definitely is set apart from other restaurants by their unique dishes and presentation. The oysters for example is presented on a bed of seaweed and poured steam water tableside to give the aroma of being by the ocean. The lamb was perfectly cook and the lemon dessert had a good balance-was tart but not overtly sweet.   I enjoyed the decor and ambience as well; I did not have any issues with noise as the other reviewers but that may be due to arriving mid day when it was less crowded. I strongly believe acorn is a great addition to the community bc of their unique presentation and also amazing entree, which I have not seen in other restaurants in the area. Although the price is slightly high, it is within reason, and definitely worth the experience. I plan to bring my parents here when they visit bc I know they will also appreciate and enjoy the service and food here at acorn

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing dishes and presentation!

BQ-iag3nF9WfR-WvMqsaVw.text: I wanted this to be a great place because 'everyone said it was'. I was left disappointed with costly drinks and food that was trying way too hard to be chic when charcuterie doesn't need to be art.   Sometimes a meal should be straight up simple instead of trying to oversimplify.

7VmUBGDK4BLtiLl6YTyo0g.text: Late night apps and drinks at this new, trendy spot on Walnut Street. The decor was clean and light.  RaeLynn is an amazing bartender.  Very friendly and knowledgeable. Our cocktails were well crafted and satisfying. We were not impressed with the Acorn Red Blend.   The food was presented beautifully and had unique flavors. The Oysters were sitting on a bed of seaweed with hot saltwater poured over the seaweed at the table. It was reminiscent of the Oceanside. The fermented pepper mash gave a spicy kick to the oysters. The Calamaretti was bursting with flavors and I enjoyed the Three Bean dish very much with chili black garlic.  I'm sure we will be back soon to try more items from the menu.

eZdgcyo5Wx-EoGxfB9dRUQ.text: If your looking for modern american food with nice flavors, stop by and give it a try.  The menu is small and seasonal but has some interesting combinations to allow for fresh and well prepared dishes.  The presentation is part of the experience, too.   There is a list of about a half dozen cocktails and beers along with limited list of wines.   I started with the Gougeres which is chicken liver mouse that comes with some tiny radish, gherkins, onions, and pickle califlower.  A wonderful presentation and very tasty starter.  For my larger plate I had the Rigatoni with has squash sofrito, anchovy, lemon, stravecchio.  The homemade pasta was perfectly cooked and the flavors of the stravecchio cheese and squash were very tasty.   Service was very good and every dish was described by the staff.   For a new recently opened restaurant, everything was well done. Welcome to the neighborhood!

O6cHmFw9v9RdTO4QFq0bfw.text: Lucky us!  Our flight to Chicago was cancelled due to weather so we made the best of it by returning to Acorn. We first tried it in 2018. Wow! It was even better the second time around.  I had the BBQ beets and the Rainbow Trout.  My friend had the Dry Aged Duck and the celeriac tar tar.   So delicious! We were stuffed but couldn't resist the deconstructed carrot cake. I had it on my first visit and couldn't pass it up.  One of the best desserts I've ever had and I'm not a dessert person.  The Chef stopped by our table and even sent over a complimentary Fernet Branca!  Our cancelled flight was a great excuse to revisit one of my favorite restaurants.

eUyRgN3QobrhAGIBNHH9Nw.text: Dinner for four last night was something of a mixed bag. Service was quite good and attentive ... servers presented each selection with flair; explaining its ingredients and preparation. Food, however, was in some cases so heavily spiced as to totally mask the main components. Two of us had the mahi that disappeared under a heavy blanket of seasonings. The pork roast and rainbow trout were nicely done. We started with the gnocchi and charred cauliflower ... both enjoyable ... and ended sharing a plate of beignets, also enjoyable. Even just half filled, the place was a little noisey ... but then what American bistro isn't now adays. May go back. My wife loves the place for lunch.

kmRCVGil-oe0oYTdsGlbDw.text: Made a reservation for four a few weeks in advance and was easily able to get the target time of 7:15pm.  Positives:  1. Great food, with very unique and interesting vegetarian options. I had the salt beets, and the rigatoni (house made!) with a black truffle-nori sauce and lobster mushrooms. I was very impressed. 2. Wonderful service. I brought my aunt and mother, who are very demanding (changing orders, changing tables, etc), and our waitress handled it all beautifully, even rushing a last-minute order of the whole fried chicken.  Less positives:  1. The chairs are super uncomfortable - all four of us were different heights and we all somehow found them difficult to sit in. 2. Not all of the tables are good - the combination of high bar stools and low booths means that many tables have a view of other peoples' butts  3. Because it's farm-to-table, the menu changes often. If you have dietary restrictions (e.g. being vegetarian) you should call them and make sure there will be something for you to eat.  All in all, a nice experience - will be returning!

pxYzIgTkzqrPn0yfFpcLVg.text: I came here for brunch with my mom and a friend on a Sunday, and we had a nice experience! I really loved the restaurant's aesthetic, and even though it was fairly busy, it was still easy to chat. Our server was super friendly and knowledgable, and all of the food arrived quickly. We shared an order of beignets, then each got the pancakes. The food was plated beautifully.The beignets were served warm and fluffy, and the dipping sauces (which included a smoked chocolate sauce--I've never seen that on a menu before!) were delicious. Our pancakes left a little more to be desired. They looked like Japanese pancakes but weren't as fluffy as a Japanese pancake typically is, and they were really crumbly. I would have liked more fruit on them, and though they were advertised as being served with walnuts, the walnuts were basically garnish. Nevertheless, other people's meals looked fantastic. Between the fantastic service, beautiful atmosphere, and proximity to Walnut street, this would be a great place to bring guests. I'm excited to try Acorn's dinner!

pN7vzQfCAAAmaG0ECgOCTw.text: Nice restaurants service was good the muscles were delicious the wine was good the rest of the food we had which was scallops clams gnocchi and I Rachelle muscles were the best of the rest of them all well over season too many flavors going on and overpriced because they need to be cleaner so you can taste it OK I pass on a client

ZzlG6UHQk6ktHuYxJVWxzA.text: This was a star-rating struggle for me.  They did have some redeeming qualities, but I didn't love the place and I doubt I would return.   Here's the scoop.    The good:   - The service was excellent.  Everyone was very friendly and the server was knowledgeable.  She described each dish in perfect detail and was formal without being stuffy.    - The place is pretty.  I sat on a bench seat and was comfortable.   - The food LOOKS great.   Top notch presentations on all of the dishes.    - The cocktails we tried were tasty.     The bad:  - Reservation process - they use a website called Tock, which did not work on the three occasions I tried.  I finally had to call.    - Limited menu.  I was totally fine, but if you have a dietary restriction, you have very limited selections.   - The food didn't taste quite as good as it looked.  While the dishes were all very pretty, they all lacked a little something in the flavor department.   - This place is more expensive that it seems. The couple of entrees ($26-$35) we got were very reasonably sized in the protein department, but the sides were just garnishes.  You'd really want to order a small plate in addition to add some balance, bringing the total to $37-$48.  The small plates were small.  The three vegetable options were barely 1/3 cup total and they ranged from $11-$13.  Drinks were also on the pricey side.  I got the pork entree and two glasses of house Pinot Gris and my total was around $75 with tip.  I wasn't hungry when I was done, but I didn't feel like my $75 was well spent either.

2M1aboyXWkrqwkb61rIONA.text: Mixed bag -  2 couples out for dinner so half the meals were good the other half not so much.  The papardelle pasta with Lemon and white truffle was delicious and the Trout dish on the menu was also a great offering but the osso buco and the pork were over done and almost inedible for the most part.  Although the sides with those dishes were very well made.  Not sure if I would go back here when each of our checks was over 120.00 including a cocktail each.  I cannot say it was worth that price.

dTDiZO8EIkJwMLKmc5Rtlw.text: Stopped in for a few of their small plates. Roasted cauliflower, tabouli, and gnocchi plates were incredible. Very creative blend of flavors. Great atmosphere and service as well!  We will definitely be back.

MRJFCl7_THnXkAJVcsH-Hg.text: Have sent two of my friends traveling to Pittsburgh to this Walnut street favorite. Both have come back with glowing reviews and many thank yous for steering them to a fantastic restaurant with a great vibe and amazing food. Service is excellent and many times you will get the chance to meet the chef as he makes the rounds to chat with guests most nights.

9fO7_sqrhVlAxbSu97uwZg.text: Singular, memorable dining.  Flavors and delightfully mixed ingredients that only an exceptional chef could bring to table.

H3XhXUXLeFlUhhyyYmpQLw.text: So sorry I didn't take any pictures but actually, the experience was better than any photo could have captured. We went last night with another couple. Our server was so convivial and professional. He knew everything in detail about the cocktails, the menu and wine pairings. The service was maybe the best we've had in Pittsburgh in a long time. And that doesn't even begin to describe how amazing the food was.  Three of the four of us had special dietary restrictions which were all easily met with minor adjustments to the dishes we chose. We had the charred cauliflower as a shared appetizer. It had an Indian spice flavor that we all enjoyed. One of us had the lamb kofta as an entree. We also ordered the chicken fried rabbit, the white bass and the trout. All so extraordinarily delicious. We kept passing around the plates because no one could decide which we loved best. Every plate was almost licked clean and if we hadn't been too self conscious I think we may have actually done it! Don't miss this place.   caulflower

vCpZWNile9lX3ciZTu82xQ.text: The menu seems limiting when you sit down however once the wait staff reviews it with you it all changes.   My husband and I ordered 2 fish dishes (tilefish and trout). Both were incredible! The tilefish was mild and tangy. The trout was hearty and robust.  We also had the califlower......yummy.    I highly recommend this restaurant.  We will be back......often.  T

SLJgwwtjWvmoSvEQJztrZQ.text: Dinner menu is a 7/10. Lunch choices are weird... 4/5 because they have good cocktails!

x2uLhEZtxxGZtoK2QYBp0w.text: I vote this to be the BEST lunch destination in Pittsburgh. Creative, fresh and top notch. I have tried everything on their lunch menu and I have liked everything.  See you soon Acorn ......

QOK4LtH7iVmcTbiIqSy-kQ.text: I would give Acorn a 4-star for the food but the overall experience in terms of price/value, noise and comfort reduces my rating.  Wine prices by the glass are high (low teens) but that has become a trend here.  But it was the price of the wine bottles that seemed more inflated with very few priced at under $50!  As others have noted, this is a pricey restaurant and the portion size in many cases (particularly the appetizers) was small.  For a party of 3, we ordered two appetizers:  the charred cauliflower ($14) and the root vegetables ($11).  The cauliflower was very tasty, the root vegetable dish was served at room temperature and was just OK.  Both dishes where on the tiny side given the price.  We each had our own entree:  Mushroom Rigatoni ($26), Arctic char ($33), and Rainbow Trout ($28).  The trout dish was a decent size and very good, the Char was undercooked and had a strong mustard sauce as well as raw onions, the pasta dish was certainly tasty but again small in portion with no other sides.   By the end of the meal, I was still moderately hungry.  Given the high price of desserts, we opted to go across the street for gelato instead.  The noise level in terms of music was high and distracting, particularly since the restaurant was not overly crowded on a Tuesday night.  Others have complained about the chairs but were not an issue for me.   Service was good but not great given the price point of this restaurant.    The menu is an interesting one though and for those willing/able to spend over $50 per person, it's certainly worth trying.

FZAFMdIJNTTJOfGCFckLQQ.text: Pricey but tasty food. Not exactly very vegetarian friendly but still there are a few options.

ulPY-Mklc5FAZl7VbVdnvA.text: Came in for a lunch over my work day.  First and foremost, 5 stars for the spicy squash soup -- I think I've only had better soup at a Michelin rated restaurant.  4 stars for the general dining area and bar. In terms of sitting for lunch, can go either way here -- particularly for someone who comes in by themself, but I took a booth which helped me spread out with my computer and respond to some emails. Loss of a star for not having WiFi to connect to. Was fairly disappointed by the burger on their lunch menu, so only 3 stars here. Fries were great and very unique, but the burger tasted way too much like a whopper. Great presentation, but it was also a bit sloppy in terms the cheese/sauce. I couldn't even finish it, which is rare for me. For me, improvement needed on burger, but maybe others like it!  I would definitely come again and thought the service was timely and friendly.  Bar also looked well stocked and wine list fairly lengthy, so I'd enjoy trying that over dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pdQUs12wrhpYFXfgYNhhMA.text: Chose Acorn for Sunday brunch.  I was visiting family and chose to try it out.  I eat out often and consider myself a foodie.  I was blown away by the service, the ambiance and then came the drinks and food.  The bloody Mary was yummy, and spicey as requested.  The food was out of this world, from presentation to taste.  I had the fried chicken with a pancake, which at first seemed an odd choice, but it was beautifully constructed and presented as well as delicious.  I have been to many excellent restaraunts in Pittsburgh.  This is in my top 3!!  Fabulous experience, Highly recommend!!!

8graqmIO3k1l_NlLQIds1Q.text: Service was very welcoming and quick to seat us! Awesome selection of cocktails and drinks, everything we tried was great! Had the lamb steak and rainbow trout dishes, both delicious. Hope to return soon!

ZptBoG7cSBSC7tFHjHoHEQ.text: tried acorn for a (very) fast lunch with my SO this weekend.  we ordered the tuna melt and greek salad.  our server was soooo good and got the food to us quickly.  salad was crisp, cold and the dressing with it was perfectly seasoned.  the tuna melt, i was told, was messy, hot and delicious. :) ice teas were refilled before we asked and the bathroom was clean.  nice new restaurant on walnut street.  we'll try it for dinner next.

IjatmrqBSVZiaXQl6J-hSw.text: Gotta go 5 stars here...and I'm happy, Pittsburgh has finally added another forward thinking menu to its quiver.   We had lunch, and it was hands down the best lunch in the city. Yes, better than Pamelas you yinzr slug.  I would like to especially mention the wedge salad...as a lover of the wedge salad, it's nice to see someone (other than Avenue B) take it seriously. It was next level stuff, I honestly couldn't stop starring at it.   Can't wait for dinner.  ..................had dinner...and ya, still five stars.   Had the cauliflower / smoked beets / Steak Diane for two   - 'cauliflower' is spelled weird  - smoked beets...I would honestly just stop in for those, it's THAT good.  - Perfectly cooked and well dressed Steak Diane. The mushrooms were cooked the way they should be, not too much.   Great night....however, I would like to mention, if the owner is listening, you need double doors...make that upgrade a priority. It's 6 months out of the year here and anyone sitting towards the front....well, you see what I mean

egcFeVU-9-5TdVCYkmFrQw.text: Are you kidding me? I'm just finding out about this place now? Wow... delicious. I'll be honest, I didn't know what to expect after reading their menu online. I thought maybe it was overpriced but nope it's worth the money. So good! Great service as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Wl11JLBt5LDU3NzAzouFlQ.text: Stumbled onto this gem while in Shadyside. Live music, aesthetic surroundings, and great mid priced food makes for a great atmosphere. Biscuits and gravy were to die for while my friend said the burger was one of the best he had.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WaWCkvAsBU_AuNm_Nzm8Aw.text: Wait staff and chef very knowledgeable and accommodating for food intolerances. Nice ambiance in the restaurant. We will be back!

lj2qTf6rawymBYO3u7GsPw.text: Over-complicated and over priced food. I am a pretty decent foodie but the ingredient list in each dish left me in the dust! some descriptions had 10 ingredients or more.  And, yes, I now know what a $12 piece of carrot cake looks and tastes like. Again, covered in lord knows how many quirky subliminal super gourmet doo dads. And, worst of all, the cake did not have much carrot or spice taste as is the norm amongst the common folks.  The owner might cook for super gourmet types and they will scream how great it is. For ordinary folks, I would pass it by in a heart beat  I am just too plain a person to need all this hype and cost.  Take your wallet !

Uy0rwXSU3ZGj1fWVnXMEag.text: Adored this spot. Our mid-week summer lunch was perfection. A clean modern mid-century ambiance set the tone for a simple edited menu of food. And that food was outstanding, served by a jovial engaging staff.  My only wish is that I'll be able to enjoy their weekend brunch, which I know would be pure bliss!!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

fLdBJHTO4poHsYuejXAYdA.text: I went here for brunch and had a great time. The restaurant has a modern design and chic vibe. We took the Chilaquiles and the shrimp and grits as our main course, and shares the pancakes as a desert to finish on a sweet note. I liked the chilaquiles better and I am already craving it again as I am writing this review. The shrimp and grits was good, but overall the flavors were not interesting enough to provoke craving for this dish. The pancakes were sweet and good. However, parts of pancakes was a too overcooked. It's a good restaurant for brunch and I would recommend you to give it a chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pancakes

1celu8l522XynOaYIHDTzw.text: I feel conflicted on how to rate this - we had an excellent dinner with wonderful service, exquisite wine and such artistic plates.  However the food fell a bit flat and was noticeably not up to the levels of the service wine and decor.   It was good enough that I'd go back, but am not scrambling to return.

dRHuvnvWiEmHxBvAwsCVQw.text: So this was my first time at Acorn and I really just wanted something cool to drink. But I wasn't prepared for the level of personal attention I got. The staff was awesome! I got a handmade cocktail with jalepenos watermelon mintband cilantro with mint. Added mezcal it was So good! Had the marinated Tomatoes and was surprised again! Fresh interesting flavor profile. It's hard to find something new to improve on a tomato salad but they did it. Chatted with the bartender for a while and she was knowledgeable and a great guide to local spirits. I will be back again. Great surprise find in shady side

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Marinated Tomatoes
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So I know it said MOCKTAIL... But what if? Frito Bandido with mezcal!

vAoIRCXmkjkALbHd45sBeA.text: The brunch was fabulous and service was impeccable. The restaurant is small and really nicely decorated. Wonderful for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

H1UMpUXxCefMEFop4mJRWg.text: Acorn is not overrated. We thought it was some of the best food we've had in Pittsburgh, with original combinations of flavors that really worked. Some of our favorites were the mussels, the cauliflower, the crab rice, and the gnocchi. Service was very attentive. The space, especially in front near the windows, has beautiful natural light. We will definitely go back.

FcLhKV-KAr8pz21_7wI_Rw.text: If you're not coming here for brunch on a semi-regular basis, what's wrong with you!? Delicious cocktails, shrimp and grits, scallion pancakes - come on! Everything our group of 8 ordered was a winner and the staff couldn't have been friendlier. As good a brunch as you'll find in the 'burgh.

2ZWvUWEHhkO0FvUe_lQJYQ.text: They recently added bagels to brunch. As a native New Yorker, I have struggled to find top quality bagels as I have lived across the Midwest. The bagels at Acorn brunch are the exception. I wish they would sell them by the dozen--they're as good as any offered at high end brunches in New York City. My wife and I will be back for more on many weekends to come.

zOCo98A5GS9Jm1z6iqS4Bw.text: Quite pricey... I like the appetizers here more than I like the main dish. Good bread and butter. The last time I went there was live (and very loud) music, which Im not sure is a good choice for a narrow and rather small restaurant :(

7AuUK_S_Jxppm88ggVtXWg.text: I've only come here for brunch so far but it was really great. I had the scallion pancakes which were super fluffy scallion pancakes topped with creamy eggs and mushrooms.  I had never had a pancake like that and will now measure all other scallion pancakes to Acorn's standard.  My brunchmate got the shrimp in grits and raved about it.  The price for the brunch was totally reasonable and comparable to everywhere else in the area and the portions were definitely not small. I highly recommend checking it out!

257Bw3_akZIBn-pbWyrjdQ.text: Had an amazing dinner here. My friend knows the chef so our table had some perks, but I could tell that the food at all the other tables was also top notch. Everything was fantastic, including the service. This place was probably top 5 meals I've had in my life. Highly recommend the beet salad and the carrot cake. We had a nice variety of other dishes and I think you can't go wrong with the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. There&#39;s also a charcuterie menu and a cocktail menu. Dinner menu is seasonal

lVn8b3vqpf2msube_dhDxA.text: Very excited about a new and fresh restaurant on Walnut Street!  Was hesitant about trying out brunch at Acorn because of their limited menu, but I'm glad I did! The service we received was professional and everyone was very attentive. I was expecting them to have a full espresso bar for brunch, but they do not.   We tried the Everything Crust - their take on lox and bagels. The homemade bread was warm and delicious!! It was my favorite thing we ordered. Also had the Chilaquies from their before noon section - it was really flavorful and filling.   Definitely a nicer brunch option in the Burgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

_eAqdm6-OP94RwBVaJt2LA.text: Lovely ambiance, I loved the space it was very intimate. Restaurant, and restrooms were kept very clean.. our server was great. I must say, I thought it would be busier for a Saturday brunch, but I didn't mind (our food came out quickly. They do however, offer OpenTable reservations which is always nice. I was surprised at how affordable the menu items were, and we were able to order a few things and share. Would highly recommend acorn for brunch, and I can't wait to check out lunch and dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Upstairs dining. OMG TURN THE HEAT DOWN!
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

1Q_4HLZhH3gdVhP8bNKnMQ.text: Absolutely amazing! Entrees wowed us, but desserts completely blew us away! If you try anything here, you must get the beignets. Food was fresh, with light portion sizes-perfect for sharing.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beignets with butterscotch, smoked chocolate sauce, and apple butter. Carrot cake in background.

WDVbbNk8u-6mMqxaf3VxiQ.text: I was really impressed with our experience at Acorn. The staff and service were spot on! Every dish we had was unique and delicious. This is one of Pittsburgh's top restaurant experiences. Go here. You will not be diasappointed.

ckmd3jrf7qggK599CCbqyQ.text: Delicious!! Amazing service, food was some of the best I've ever had! We went there for Easter brunch, I highly recommend.

UTiowxkeAvHpzH88bFvFqg.text: Good vibes and friendly service. The sauces were great! The pork loin was soft, but it almost reminded me of overpriced ham. Definitely a bit on the pricier end for dinner, so next time will revisit for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork loin

JNiPY1yQqZFKpHJhsPp1Sg.text: I think Acorn is a fantastic addition to Walnut street. We went for a birthday lunch in early March. The atmosphere was calming and the service was fantastic.  My friend's ordered the omelettes and really liked them. I ordered the grilled cheese, but didn't care for it-- all I could taste was thick, American cheese. I noticed this isn't on the menu anymore, so maybe they took it out of rotation. The side salad was simple and delicious.   This is definitely the place for a nice sit-down lunch. I'd be back to try some other things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. grilled cheese ~$12, 3/5 stars
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. grilled cheese ~$12, 3/5 stars
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. omelette ~14$, 4/5 stars

82BtnflQJ_7Q-Z1hxmrt7g.text: Fish tacos scallion pancakes and bagel with lox.  how does this combo sound for brunch?  Not bad.  The food is very fresh and the execution is excellent.    The place would be five stars if they cut the sodium in half.  Especially the bagel, with the lox, the caper, cream cheese, uh!

gf3r4ph76_ot2IZkbnyvfw.text: Enjoyed a fun evening out with friends. The holiday decorations throughout created a festive atmosphere. The crowd picked up as the evening progressed. The staff was friendly and accommodating to our questions. Sad they didn't have any soup; however, the dishes we shared were excellent. We snacked on the bread & butter, gnocchi, crab rice and escargot. My favorite among the dishes was the crab rice followed by the bread and butter. For beverages, I enjoyed the blueberry vanilla soda mocktail and my friends had the spearmint teas to warm them up. We opted for dessert and split the beignets which came hot out of the oven. I would visit again and try some of the other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bread
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blueberry vanilla soda mocktail
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Festive holiday decorated seating area

FjhUxx1DfE0UfbFT2HxvLA.text: Came here for brunch on a Saturday morning! It was a nice day so the front on walnut was completely open. There was also live music. We each had the eggs and potatoes and then shared the pancakes. The eggs and potatoes were pretty standard but the pancakes were AMAZING. If you go, you have to try them. They were decadent little pillows of joy. They are super fluffy as they are probably an inch high and are served with a yummy caramelized sauce, peaches, and cream. I did not even need the extra syrup. They were a nice dessert to our meal. The prices are also very reasonable for brunch! Definitely check it out if you are in Shadyside!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eggs and potatoes with pancakes
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brunch spread
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing pancakes!

pzbz0JRU1ImrUIUPI7YdBg.text: I recently visited Acorn with my boyfriend for my belated birthday dinner and we got both the Roasted Duck and Rainbow Trout entree. Every component on the dishes were simply delicious and cooked to perfection. We would definitely come back. I've also been for brunch and that was also wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rainbow Trout
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roasted Duck

PgG-l6TBpbg1lvPpkH0YBQ.text: Had my birthday dinner here. It was nothing less than amazing!! The atmosphere was perfect. We had a great waiter and the food was incredible.   We shared the beet salad, tabouleh, and tenderloin for 2. Unbelievable. A new favorite. And the lemon cake dessert! What a celebration. We will be back. Please try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KrHpgHwmnBDg2AEHGwFV_g.text: Acorn is an awesome addition to Walnut Street! I stopped in this morning and got to try the brunch menu. I loved the love music (which I've seen every time I walk past!) It is a great addition to the atmosphere. I had the chilaquiles which were phenomenal and paired wonderfully with my mimosa. My friend had the shrimp and grits which were excellent, but she was underwhelmed by the Bloody Mary. Our server was kind and prompt. It may sound crazy, but we both were bothered by how uncomfortable the chairs were! They were angled very strangely and unless you were sitting in a very recliner fashion they cut into your lower back. May seem silly, but it may be the reason we ran out instead of trying another drink. Overall, I enjoyed the experience and can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

PhwAiRUxc2zzkc1vy3B36A.text: I had a very delicious meal here! Their special small plate was freshly picked chanterelles (by the chef!) sauteed with garlic, corn and pine nuts. Although quite filling I also had the linguine. This vegetarian option did not disappoint. Extremely flavorful and rich. The staff was helpful without being over bearing. The setting is an open concept - comfortable and contemporary.

_k8kYj1he_n5meIqqy4JFQ.text: We have been to Acorn for both dinner and brunch. The food is delicious and always tastes fresh. We particularly love going for brunch (in the last month, we havengone 3x). We love their fish tacos (amazing flavor) and pancakes. Their alcoholic beverages are also unique and tasty. The service has always been phenomenal. Overall, we highly recommend this place for its tasty food, drinks and great service.

Zim9kQlGaYwEaCq6qdX1ZQ.text: Phenomenal service, phenomenal food.  We tried the crab fried rice, artichoke and gnocchi, followed by the chicken and pappardelle.  The artichoke was unlike any you've ever had but amazing balance of acid and flavor.  The chicken was...the best chicken we have ever had....bar none!  Service was very good.  You must try this lovely place.

n7muOn4hM-1GBvSWXQT47w.text: Acorn is DELICIOUS. Both brunch and dinner are great, we've gone 5 times in the last 3 weeks

r-yiYE4Ot2gLxwQdOiDL_w.text: Short menu rendered cleanly by the kitchen. Great atmosphere and engaged, gracious serving team. Scratch bar.   My lovely counterpart was impressed by her "build your own" salad, commenting that it was one of best steak salads she had ever had. My fish/chips was excellent and fun. Highly recommended -- we will visit again.

90bZUV1BvjHYzBG43QjiZQ.text: Such an amazing culinary experience! My husband and I went here for brunch. I ordered the chilaquiles and he ordered the shrimp and grits and they were both spectacular! My cocktail (I think it was called what your mum ordered) was so good too. We ended brunch with beignets that came with 3 sauces. Loved the caramel maple it was absolutely divine! Will definitely go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chilaquiles
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beignets

Q19YhQ8oZ_5kY4s1oFDNcw.text: I'm not a big restaurant reviewer, but I had to take the time to acknowledge another wonderful meal at Acorn. Our first time here was easily the most welcome we've felt in a Pittsburgh restaurant. The owner/chef took time to chat with us which was a real treat. What a quality human! Today's visit was just as delightful (try the chilaquiles or shrimp & grits!).  I've gone to a lot of restaurants in my life and only the finest establishments care enough to do more than put good food in front of you. To get that level of service from a restaurant without white table cloths is definitely my kinda place. Pittsburgh is becoming a really foodie town, but Acorn has set the bar for food & service. Go there immediately, if not sooner.

LEb86Z6TR7O5a7stMSf_CA.text: Absolutely fantastic!  Dry aged ribeye was soft, tender and flavorful. Desert was fun! Crab rice was so creative and exciting. I will also recommend rainbow trout, xo sauce and glass noodles were tasty (somewhat a HongKong style dish).  The only thing we didn't care for was salted cod. We mentioned it to the waiter when he took it away. Without any further discussion, they took it off our check. Very classy and great service!  This place deserves Michelin stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rainbow trout with xo sauce. So good
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salted cod. The bread is good. But won&#39;t recommend this dish.
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dessert

cXsWt8JmHqruy4G5ER9NJg.text: Just wow!  * Food: I came here for my birthday dinner a few weeks ago and I'm glad we picked this place. For appetizers, we got the shrimp toast and mussels (I can't seem to find this on the online menu anymore). I could not decide which one I liked better. The shrimp toast came with chunky scallops and a piece of octopus which tasted so good. The sauce was so savory and tiny bit sweet, I just wanted to take it home! For entrees we got the Linguine and Salmon. The sauce in salmon I ordered was so good I also wanted to take that home. The Linguine was very rich and the portion was generous. They had bits of pistachios in it which was a good touch.     * Cost vs. Worth: Their dinner prices are the same compared to other restaurants with three money signs. Entrees are around $30 and appetizers are around $15. The food is definitely worth the cost.  Will I come here again? - I definitely want to try their lunch menu next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp Toast
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mussels

N_uv16TJpNOf7zTfywhuOA.text: We did a stay cation in the city and ventured to shadyside.  We were told last night at a wedding that Acorn was a great place to go for brunch.   Let me tell you we were not disappointed.  The ambiance was very trendy.  The service was incredible and the FOOD... omg soo good!  I had the steak and eggs they cooked it to perfection!  My boyfriend had the fish tacos and I'm pretty sure there wasn't a crumb left on his plate!    I highly recommend this location if you're looking for s great brunch on a weekend.  Brunch is only served on weekends.  They do also serve lunch and dinner.  We can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MmMEmc_ACIR76YCtH1ipmw.text: Well isn't this a great little find. I think 5 stars would be a little aggressive especially because I have only been for brunch but it was a great meal. Service was friendly and even though we were seated 30 minutes before they closed they still didn't rush us.   My brother and I split the Matzo ball soup, bagel and lox, and the chicken salad. It was all so fresh but still so comforting. I did feel like the everything bagel was a little bit over toasted, it was kinda darker than I'd like On the bottom and a little hard as a sandwich but the flavors were perfect. Loved the caper schmear.   Will absolutely be back and hopefully for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Top: chicken salad Right: everything bagel with lox Bottom: matzo ball soup

T2JSrfNKZ-m7-tr7t03LEQ.text: Came here for dinner with friends and saw that it was located in such a cute area that we had to try it out. I have to say that I was VERY pleased with the level of quality in the food.   ~~ Parking: Can be kind of hard to find parking since there are so many shops around, but it's located in a nice area that allows you to walk around to check out some of the neighboring shops before/after eating.   ~~ Service: Great! Our server Nathan was super nice, started to forget about checking in on us towards the end (mainly for water), but he was super kind and was willing to answer any questions that we had on the menu.   ~~ Best Part: THE FOOD. The food actually surprised me becuase there wasn't actually anything that I disliked. The carrots were lacking a little in flavor in comparison to the other foods (but it's most likely intended to be that way).   ~~ Worst Part: Water refills towards the end, but it wasn't THAT big of a deal.   ~~ Tips: Try the whole chicken! The fried 1/2 of the chicken is cooked perfectly and the dips that come with the platter are amazing! But you really can't go wrong with anything on this menu.   ~~ Return: If I'm ever in Pittsburgh again, yes!!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Whole Chicken (portion for 2 ppl)
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sparkling water
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu (drinks) page 2

3fRCkPc5Z8Mcwgv6HAwexw.text: This was our first dinner at Acorn, but we ate here many times when it was Thai Place. The building has been remodeled but it has not been changed structurally. Acorn's menu is limited but pretty creative. We had the linguine and lamb entrees. The pasta was very good but the lamb was a little disappointing. We also went for desert, which was unusual. The beignets were excellent. Service was very good, especially help with the unusual menu. Our martinis were fine but the wine list was disappointing. Choices were very limited and prices were high, although it was difficult because the list was limited to unique wines not available in local stores. This obfuscation is intentional and, in my view, disingenuous. Overall the experience was favorable and we would probably return, but the attraction is not strong.

_qvjs9nmVYJxnZ_mvbu5hQ.text: You won't find a menu like this anywhere else on Walnut street. Unlike many Shadyside spots they have plenty of table and bar seatings. We visited on a Friday night and quickly found a place to sit.   Our server was charming and knowledgeable. We found several items containing ingredients we'd never heard of before. He explained each dish to us giving his best recommendations along the way. The menu is spit into big and small plates. We ordered the charcuterie board, and two small plates- the gnocchi and the cauliflower. The small plates made the dinner. Both had so much flavor we were blown away. I'd love to stay I'll try something new next time I visit, but honestly I'd love to have both again.   It's the perfect place for dinner or a small plate and a drink. You'll certainly be happy you stopped.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

f-6mewXs0Hz4KsZ29pJ-9w.text: Great brunch/lunch spot in Shadyside! I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and finally did. I had the lox sandwich. The capers cream cheese was a little salty so I probably wouldn't order that dish again but all the other food people were ordering around us looked good! Someone in my party ordered the chicken salad and said it was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WfFivdyMOTkUJPuJqsb68A.text: I had my birthday dinner here a few weeks ago. Acorn is definitely a fine dining place in the neighborhood.  We had the escargot and carb "rice" as appetizers and rainbow trout and dry aged duck as entrees. All dishes were beautifully executed, proteins were perfectly cooked, and the dish presentation was innovative. Also, portion size is larger than I expected, so I'm pretty much full after having the crab "rice" appetizer. Although the food here taste great, the dished we ordered were too heavy for me, especially the sauces came with escargot/trout, which overwhelmed other components of the dish. It would be perfect to have some elements on these dishes to balance the greasiness, so I took out one star.  Service is great yet slightly lacking, probably because there weren't many customers that night. Overall, great high-end spot for special occasions. Dinner price is $50+/person.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bar
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dry aged duck
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rainbow trout

Dj81j64vVnhk-dYFoaaWRg.text: This is by far one of my favorites of Pittsburgh. We went on a Sunday, and because it's in Shadyside, we thought for sure we would be struggling for a table. As we walked down Walnut Street we saw this HUGE line at Pamela's right across the street. When we walked into Acorn there were a few tables available, live music, and such a great vibe walking in. I cannot believe those people were at Pamela's and not Acorn. For now, it's a hidden gem, but once people realize it's there, good luck getting a spot!!  Ugh we have come back every weekend we are down there, it's is incredible!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

d7tKcof8sNdojRs8LqeVXw.text: This was probably one of the best meals I've had in Pittsburgh in a while! My husband and I decided to come here last minute and sat at the bar. It was hard to decide what to order since everything on the menu looked so good. The bartender was very helpful and went over some of the menu items with us. We ended up ordering 3 small plates and an entree so we could share a bunch of things. We had the gnocchi, crab "rice", and tomatoes to start. The tomatoes dish was a standout. It came with whipped ricotta and a flatbread with roasted garlic. The chef uses a lot of unique flavors and everything was perfectly seasoned. We had the tuna steak for our entree and it was prepared al pastor style. Definitely a very unique preparation of tuna and it was very tasty and a perfect entree to enjoy on a summer night. Overall, the meal was fantastic and I can't wait to go back !

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tuna Steak Al Pastor
Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab &#34;rice&#34; and the tomatoes dish

JXy6jUCvG5Cym2zdKn0x9Q.text: We went a few months ago for cocktails and appetizers and it was a great experience! The food was amazing - it felt like going out to eat in NYC or Chicago. I think I've found my new favorite spot in town

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy Hour Menu

gBhm4uQ6W3vc1GXQRMp_bg.text: I've been to Acorn for dinner and brunch. The brunch was great. Great food, really affordable, good drink list, great service. I strongly recommend the chilaquiles and my girlfriend loved the biscuits and gravy. Would rate 5 stars.   Dinner was more disappointing. I got the gnocchi and charred cauliflower. The second dish was fine, nothing to write home about but the gnocchi was not good. It was cooked way too long and became soggy. The brown butter didn't really go in my opinion. My friend went for the rainbow trout and was happy with the dish.   Between a 3 star dinner and 5 star brunch we find ourselves at 4 stars. I'm going to give Acorn one more chance for dinner, maybe it was just that 1 in 100th dish that doesn't get made to the quality they are going for. However, this place has rocketed to my top 3 favorite brunch spots!

q7G_vCdgF6jL5awR8IiitQ.text: GOSH what an amazing place. Cute atmosphere inside, friendly staff, pretty reasonably priced for what feels like really elevated food. Every dish our table had was great (although I recommend the scallion pancake over the standard pancake if available) Bubbly sodas were delicious. A restaurant I will definitely visit again when I'm in the area.

us5HUeMsaldPtTwdFrd_UQ.text: The steak and eggs are amazing!! Best thing I've had for brunch in a long time. The steak has a chimichurri sauce on it. It tastes fresh and a little tangy. The eggs were perfectly cooked. I asked for mine to be scrambled. My husband's burger was delicious as well.

C5-vo5NghlZ757iZQoahTw.text: tl;dr - romantic atmosphere, seasonal menus  Our friends brought us here while we were visiting Pittsburgh. It's located on this quaint street lined with boutiques and shopping.  I ordered the escargot appetizer and it was tasty and well seasoned. I also tried two main dishes: a semolina mushroom pasta and duck with octopus. You can definitely taste the mushroom in the pasta, however, I found the dish overall to be a little lacking in flavor. Also, I like my pasta al dente, but this was slightly too chewy for my taste. The duck was amazing though. It was nice and tender and the sauce was really rich and delicious. The octopus was nice and soft and went really well with the overall flavor.  The service was great and the overall atmosphere would make this a great place for a romantic evening. I was also told that they change their menu frequently.

HQVu5KNIgPerWC2QG0vyvw.text: We made reservations for brunch. I would suggest reservations on Saturday it did get busy. Atmosphere is modern and sophisticated yet casual cozy. They make their bagels in house I suggest trying them! Very good! Must try peach pancakes they were very fluffy!

Y_HMwLOve3DP6q3_CfTBDg.text: Wow. The flavors of this place are incredible! Finally, a chef who isn't afraid of bold seasoning. I can't think of a pork dish I've had as perfectly prepared as the pork loin was here!  Also, who would have thought I'd be blown away by a bread and butter dish but the goat butter, jam and honey comb were just right.  The cocktails were very good as well. Unique enough to be interesting but not so over the top that they taste weird. Just delicious.  Finally, I appreciated that the decor is neither too pretentious nor was it too vintage so I was comfortably fancy!

kkC3DuMHthvDN_ku3QvQBQ.text: This little door on Walnut street is a special spot. Upon walking in, I was surprised to see there was seating that extended far back into the restaurant, and a seating style for every visitor. There's a few high tops right by the street windows, booths for those that want a little more privacy, bar stools if you plan to just chat over small plates & cocktails, and tables with many seats.   The atmosphere is inviting and upscale without being pretentious. There are tea lights lining the high top, full bar and soft but rich earthy colors setting a comfortable romantic vibe.   The menu is a bit eclectic, hiding really intricate ingredients and flavors within both the drinks and dishes. Ask the waiters about anything and everything. They're very knowledgeable on how each option is prepared and can help you choose exactly which dish you'll love. Be open minded when choosing as the options may be unfamiliar in many ways, but after this visit I really trust that everything on here is delicious.  This is a great chance to try complex flavor pallets and pair it with a cocktail you'd never make for yourself. A perfect spot for a special occasion. The bill will be quite expensive for Shadyside, however it's worth it in my opinion for this kind of detail oriented meal that's paired with a really lovely environment.   I'd stick to the menu though and probably refrain from the charcuterie board. Although piled with an array of options - I thought the board was a bit too heavy on cheese options, too light on breads/crackers to eat the meats and cheeses with, and you really had to work your way through the board to get to the different components. Everything was piled on top of other things and by the time we discovered our favorites on this board, we were too full to eat them. And honestly, at the end of the day, it's just another charcuterie board.  A great option for walking to if you live in Shadyside, otherwise there's some pay to park garages and lots off the side streets if all street parking is taken.

photos.caption: Photo of Acorn Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Full charcuterie board at Acorn. Spicy and tangy mustards, with a lot of cheese options, pickled veggies, and various nuts and cured meats.

_mxElF-qNWTPrfkEOsL1Jw.text: I came here for brunch on a Saturday around 11am. We got seated immediately and the restaurant had a very nice open layout with a bar area. For brunch we ordered the chilaquiles, shrimp and grits, and pancakes for dessert.   The service and presentation are excellent. The chilaquiles were really delicious. They had a nice kick to them and the egg on top was cooked perfectly. The shrimp and grits was also good although I didn't love the peppers that came with it. I would have preferred the grits without it. If I came back I would probably order the fish tacos instead of the shrimp and grits. The pancakes for dessert were great. They were very fluffy and I loved the meringue on top of the pancakes.   Overall, it was a nice brunch to go to. I will definitely come back when I'm in the area to try some of their other dishes.

kIp8UW83p1zNykkgUPPDow.text: We have been there twice and both times it was great! The appetizers are the best, try the carrots with the goat butter and the tomato and cucumber. As for entrees we had the fried chicken and the rib eye (we had a large group) and both were amazing. Don't forget to finish with the lemon dessert!

kU4OtMZDjG59UcjVCmbvVQ.text: Fantastic addition to Walnut Street! I would not be considered a foodie; I am more into the atmosphere and drinks. I could gush about those but it is the food that takes center stage. The food was wonderful. The tomato and cucumber...amazing. It sounds so simple. It presents beautifully and all the flavors come together to taste delicious. The monkfish was spectacular. I don't eat red meat but the others at the table thought the ribeye was the best they ever had (and I would consider them to be foodies  ). We look forward to our next visit!

IAwJBa-sBOzxAhjxr9YLrg.text: Do not miss this place!  The food is amazing. Much of the menu "sounds" a bit strange but it's truly wonderful food. We had the squash, Brussels sprout tarting and gnocchi...every bite was delicious.  They also have hand crafted cocktails that are seasonal. Service is smart, professional and very knowledgeable. Cozy warm atmosphere.

pF2z3n13L50E023dLNmDoQ.text: I want to thank Randy, the manager, for responding to my yelp review. I really appreciate it! I understand now the reason that you seemed aloof given the frustration you felt. I will definitely give acorn another chance. Thank you Randy!

J4nPYofExzok59HRH_thtA.text: Acorn is a total fine dining experience in a professional but friendly and casual atmosphere.   It's not "comfort food," it's inventive cuisine with combinations you likely haven't seen before, and so requires a willingness to be surprised by the varied tastes. The welcoming was warm;  the staff was attentive and knowledgeable about the ingredients and methods of preparation; bar menu was solid.  For starters we had the "bread and butter," the oysters, calamaretti and the gougeres.  Entrees were lamb, NY strip and rigatoni.  It was a birthday celebration and the kitchen treated us to a chocolate mousse and a strawberry ice cream that were outstanding.  Acorn is a five-star addition to the Shadyside and Pittsburgh dining scene.

ycPPsUwbARXWslgT7jDSWg.text: Came here with family the day after Thanksgiving.  Everyone enjoyed their meal, the veal sausage and squash appetizers were great.  Also, the trout and lamb entrees were great.  Would recommend.

126VJa2Guthsinfk2oRmQA.text: This sleek, modern simple space on Walnut Street in Pittsburgh's Shadyside neighborhood offers a variety of seating options -- tables, booths, high tops or at the beautiful modern wooden bar. Having eaten at restaurants all over Pittsburgh and the world, I'm pleased to have an option in Pittsburgh offering food preparations that I've yet to see or enjoy anywhere else. Add to that that they're as artfully prepared and visually stunning as any that I've ever seen. The set-up menu is a little quirky with small plates including some that could work as sides and some entrees that feed two more, but once you get the hang of it, it turns out to be perfect for tables that like to share and explore more menu items; plus the servers can help to steer you in the right direction. The oysters are my favorite app on the menu. A half dozen of them are served with a foam atop each one that adds just the right amount of zing. They're placed over seaweed and when served, hot oyster water is poured on the sides, to steam the oysters. A tomato and cucumber salad screams off fresh and rests in a dill dressing rather than being covered in it. Broccoli Tartine is a unique dish that would work as a starter or a side. Octopus with elote and queso is beyond delicious. A few entrees for two are among the options and one is a whole chicken. There's not a bone in it. The moist breasts are sliced, but the highlight is the tender thighs, lightly fried and served over dirty rice. A fermented coconut and a soy-based concoction work for dipping. Chicken leg confit combines with green papaya to make a sort of chicken papaya salad. A rigatoni entree with squash sofrito didn't disappoint. There's just two dessert options -- a lemon and a chocolate option, but they're each just the right size and served in an eye-popping colorful display that tastes every bit as good as it looks and includes unique ingredients such as meringue and fennel. Beers are only available on tap and are entirely local. It's a small, but interesting selection. The cocktail list includes some classics with a twist and there's a decent selection of wines as well. Servers and bartenders seem to be consistently pleasant and sweet. Some who have meat and potato preferences may complain that they don't understand the menu or that it's too expensive. Acorn may not be for everyone, but if you're looking for something truly different and unique, you're likely to love it. My only two complaints are things that can easily be addressed: It's a little too bright, but nothing that a dimmer switch won't resolve. It's also more than a little loud once it gets busy, but some acoustic tiles would easily help combat that.
